item.title: Methods
item.description: Described below is a brief description of methods, data and model parameters used at 613covid.ca. More detailed information can be found in the accompanying references. Projection models All data used to create projection models can be accessed at Open Ottawa. See ’COVID-19 cases and deaths`. Covid-19 case projections created using the Bayesian SEIR model developed by Simon Fraser University. Projections are based on observed covid-19 cases by episode date.

Model use There are two main uses of the projections: Short-term projections (2 to 4 weeks) inform the current level of covid-19 transmssion. In turn, current covid-19 transmission reflects effectivess of ongoing covid-19 prevention and control. Short-term projections the immediate need health care such hospital and critical care services for COVID-19 patients. Long-term projections (6 weeks onward) to assess the potential effect of changes in covid-19 transmission. In turn, future covid-19 transmission reflects potential changes to covid-19 re-opening stages and the effectiveness of cvoid prevention and control.

item.title: Changelog
item.description: Updates involving only data updates will no longer be documented. V3.1.0 2020-10-13 Wastewater page added describing covid-19 wastewater surveillance. V3.0.0 2020-10-05 Case data & projections have been added to the website. See model for more details on how projections for cases were created including input parameters. Ventilator & peak projections removed from website. Death figure removed from website. V2.3.0 2020-08-05 Projections use OPH hospitalization data from 07/07/2020 onwards.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Media contact: Michaela Schreiter, Media Relations Officer, The Ottawa Hospital, mschreiter@toh.ca ph: 613-222-7674 Science contacts: Doug Manuel dmanuel@ohri.ca, Warsame Yusuf waryusuf@ohri.ca, Alan Forster Acknowledgements for website and content: Warsame Yusuf, Rostyslav Vyuha, Yulric Sequeira, Andrew Fitches, and others on Big Life Lab team. Supporting Ottawa Public Health epidemiologists: Amira Ali, Jacqueline Willmore, Dara Spatz uOttawa – CHEO SARS-CoV-2 research group: Robert Delatolla, Alex MacKenzie, Patrick D’Aoust, Élisabeth Mercier, Antoine Cantin, Tyson Graber

item.title: Ottawa covid-19 wastewater surveillance (development page)
item.description: The National Capital Region is one of the first communities in Canada to conduct daily wastewater readings to help inform its community response in the fight against covid-19, thanks to innovative research from the CHEO Research Institute (CHEO RI) and the University of Ottawa (uOttawa). The figures below were created by researchers at CHEO RI and uOttawa. Learn more about wastewater epidemiology and its role in covid-19 surveillance on Ottawa Public Health’s website.

item.title: Roadmap
item.description: The main purpose of this site is to visualize Ottawa-based projections for models performed by other teams. Review and update model parameters based on recent published studies. Priories for review: ventilated patients deaths
